intro: Hieracium tarachodon, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium tarachodon is known for its ability to spread rapidly through rhizomes and is considered a weed in some regions.
